item.title: 05 Dec 2025 01:30
item.description:
Tom’s post nudged me to revive my Digital photo frame that I set up last year. Turned it on this morning and it lit up like it was setup a minute ago. Love it! Took me a minute though to figure out how I’d initially set it up since I missed documenting it then. So here’s a quick note for posterity.

Hardware

  • Display: 15.6" Portable Display by Arzopa
  • Frame: A spare Ikea frame
  • SBC Board: A repurposed Raspberry Pi 3 from that snazzy Nextcloud Box
  • Thumb-drive for photos
  • Black Duct-tape!

Configuration

I leaned on the awesome DietPi OS for the base operating system. Once the system boots up a script runs FEH to display photos from the thumb-drive.

#! /bin/sh
cd /mnt/photos
feh -Z -z -F -D 60 --hide-pointer --auto-rotate

Essentially FEH picks up photos from the thumbdrive, random sorts them and displays a properly zoomed and oriented image every minute.

Choosing images

I currently manage my photo collection by syncing them into my Nextcloud server sorted by year, month and occasion. At the end of every month, I use Digikam to tag and export photos like-so:

  1. All photos are tagged by their month
  2. Then photos that I want to display on the screen are tagged as ‘Arzopa’.
  3. A saved search query exports these to the Thumbdrive.

Making this a manual process forces me to take a step back and actually choose what gets displayed on the screen besides giving me another opportunity to go back in time.

Next Steps

  • Setup scripts to turn off/on the screen based on the environment or time.
  • Enable touchscreen or button options to pause and navigate photos on demand. ðŸ”—

item.title: 03 Dec 2025 10:30
item.description: My wife and I still haven’t figured where/when we want to retire yet, but sadly the U.S. seems to be a bleaker option with every passing day. I don’t think any country has really figured out their healthcare system well and those that had a decent stab at it seem to be hell bent on breaking it. For now, thankfully our Foreign service benefit plan does an okay job and we’re at an okay premium-benefit ratio. Only a question of time before that buckles though. As a former actuary, I do subscribe to the concept of having good insurance. However, the good ones are so few and stretched so thin. I keep telling my wife if we want to stay in the U.S. I should get back to teaching - Not just because I love it, but because it might also keep our premiums low in retirement. ðŸ”—

item.title: 22 Nov 2025 10:30
item.description:
After a failed attempt last week, I made it up to Mbankolo this morning. Romero joined me and we ran into an LGF at the base of the hill. This place is pretty neat and way better than Mt. Febe! So glad I decided to give this another shot.

On the way back, instead of coming via the market, we decided to climb up towards Mt. Febe and took the inner roads via the golf course. This could be a fun route to retrace on the reverse sometime later.

I need to figure out why my garmin isn’t recording the GPX properly. Oddly, Looks like all other metrics are logged correctly. The only thing I really changed was syncing it with GadgetBridge last week.

item.title: 14 Nov 2025 10:30
item.description:
Why does it feel like I’ve been writing the same story multiple times over the last three days? Because, maybe I actually did?

Wrote something to that effect earlier today to one of the teams I’ve been trying to resolve an ongoing issue with. They are a good bunch of folks. But there seems to be a disconnect somewhere that’s causing needless delays in what I’d like to get done. I feel issues fail to get resolved mostly because of lack of proper communication during their shift handovers.

A few minutes after I sent that note, somewhere it also hit me real hard. I shouldn’t really have sent that note? It does not benefit anybody but just my restless self. Adds nothing positive to the situation and if anything effectively brings the relationship a few steps backwards. Super frustrating when you see both sides of the coin and still need to get shit done…ðŸ”—

item.title: 14 Oct 2025 17:30
item.description:
Two weeks into the shutdown and neither party seems to be in a rush to sort this out. Thankfully we have decent savings. Also does help that the state department has always paid two weeks late. This paycheck should be about 70% my regular paycheck accounting for work done until Sep 30th. There’s talk of this shutdown maybe making it to Thanksgiving. Historically, they’ve responded when ATC / TSA folks threw in their towels…This time around might be different though.

M wants to go to London with S. Thinking we should be able to absorb that cost. And then there’s the Virginia trip. Might be a pricey end of the year!

On the work front, looks like that Malabo trip is gonna happen.

Cameroon had its elections last sunday and Issa Tchiroma unilaterally declared victory today. Something that the Constitutional Council said would be considered ‘High treason’. They made it so far with very little unrest. Next few weeks though portends to be interesting! The worlds’ oldest and longest serving president might not be all so benevolent after all. ðŸ”—

item.title: 05 Oct 2025 14:30
item.description:
Between M&S taking ill earlier this week and the shutdown/furlough drama on Wednesday, last week whizzed by.

Joined the Poth’s for a game night on Friday. S and the kids watched Home while we played a bunch of games. Building your empire, Skyjoy, Really bad art, and that one real interesting game which we didn’t quite get to play…2100 and had to get S to bed to be ready for the Swim meet next day.

Reconnected with D. Konduru after almost 6 years. Time files!

You can’t tell people anything popped in my Rewind today. I don’t quite remember posting about this but I’m so glad I saved it in my wallabag instance. HabitatChronicles seems to be having a database issue and the site’s down.

S has gotten into rainbow looms. Keeps her quite busy but also generates A LOT of loom bracelets and rings.

Have had barely any time to tinker with stuff this weekend. S’s swim meet sucked most of Saturday and M was out almost all of Sunday for various things.

Prepped the two SSDs that I bought earlier this week. Should RSYNC backup my data files from the now almost 10 year old hard drive before it goes kaput.

Setup a Radicale instance in my homeserver and configured DAVx5 on my phone to tidy up all my contacts and calendars. While at it, I also installed and setup the FOSS Calendar app as the primary calendar app on my phone. Super slick and tidy! Should have made this switch way before…ðŸ”—
